title: Charlotte Crosby on Josh Ritchie's proposal plans and having no surgery regrets
text:
Charlotte Crosby and Josh Ritchie moved in together recently (Picture: Backgrid)

Charlotte Crosby and boyfriend Josh Ritchie took their relationship to the next level recently, moving into their own home together.

And the Geordie Shore star has revealed they’re happier than ever since taking the plunge.

Opening up about their romance, the 29-year-old exclusively told Metro.co.uk: ‘We’re really happy! It’s amazing, it’s never been better, and I’m not just saying that. The love that I have for that boy is just overwhelmingly strong. It could bring us to tears, that’s how much I love him.

‘How is everything so perfect? I’ve just got this overwhelming feeling, it’s better than better, you can’t even top it. I’m happier than happy, it’s euphoric!’

Some of her closest friends have recently got engaged – including MTV co-star Holly Hagan, and In The Style boss Adam Frisby.

But the reality star isn’t putting any pressure on her beau to get down on one knee any time soon, because she’s loving just how ‘perfect’ everything is between them.

‘Everything is so perfect, I am so happy, I don’t want to rush anything,’ she continued. ‘I’m so happy that I’m not one of these girlfriends that’s constantly in his ear like, “I need a ring, I need a baby!”

‘I honestly think I’m the most perfect girlfriend anyone could ask for.

‘There’s no other pressure on us, and I think that’s the reason why we’re so incredibly happy.

‘When that time comes, it will be absolutely amazing, and it’ll come because Josh wants to do it off his own back, and that’s what will make it even more special.’

Charlotte insisted she has zero regrets about going under the knife (Picture: In The Style)

Charlotte has been on our screens since the second she stepped foot in the Geordie Shore house, way back in 2011.

Seriously, how has it been that long?!

And she explained there are huge downsides to living her life in the public eye, after vile trolls drove her to have plastic surgery.

However, she insisted she has absolutely no regrets about going under the knife.

‘I didn’t regret having my boobs done,’ she said. ‘Everyone [on social media] has a go about having surgery, but then but then you have thousands of people telling you that you’re ugly.

She wanted to make her In The Style range as inclusive as possible (Picture: In The Style)

‘It’s a lose / lose situation, and such an annoying subject.

Advertisement

‘Sometimes you have to develop a thick skin.’

And Charlotte put inclusivity at the forefront of her new In The Style autumn and winter range, as she wants to make sure everyone feels comfortable in her clothes.

‘It’s really important that any type of girl can get the range and feel great in it, that’s a massive thing,’ she added.

‘I want everyone to feel like they can have part of my range in their wardrobe. All the styles are perfect for any shape and size, you always just feel confident.

‘I’ve worked with ITS for just over 5 years, as a brand, they’re so dedicated to creating amazing individual collections.

‘It’s just so important to them, they way they care about their ambassadors and their customers, it’s so important to me to work with a brand like that.’

Charlotte Crosby x In The Style is available now at www.inthestyle.com.
